Patient V188 was evaluated for a language disorder. The patient also presented with a stooped posture and reduced tendon reflexes. Subsequent sequencing of A467T revealed a pathogenic variant.

Patient V189 was evaluated for an ataxic gait. The patient also presented with an elevated GGT and a coagulation disorder. Subsequent sequencing of c. 2243G>C (p. W748S) revealed a pathogenic variant.

Patient V190 was evaluated for a deficit in vibratory sense. The patient also presented with an ataxic gait and a hunched-over stance. Subsequent sequencing of 2263A>G K755E revealed a pathogenic variant.
The primary symptoms for Patient V191 were aphasia and a focal motor seizure. Analysis of the c3239G>C p.Ser1080Thr was performed.
We report the case of Patient V192, who has a history of an elevated GGT. Examination also revealed a focal motor seizure. The underlying cause was traced to a mutation in c. 2243G>C (p. W748S).
The clinical profile for Patient V193 includes a focal motor seizure and a forward-leaning posture. Genetic analysis of 1868T>G L623W confirmed the diagnosis.

The clinical profile for Patient V194 includes reduced vibration sense and a coagulation disorder. Genetic analysis of 15q26 118 kb deletion involving POLG1 gene and FANCI gene confirmed the diagnosis.

Patient V195 was evaluated for a focal motor seizure. The patient also presented with a coagulation disorder and reduced vibration sense. Subsequent sequencing of 2263A>G K755E revealed a pathogenic variant.
We report the case of Patient V196, who has a history of reduced vocal volume. Examination also revealed unintentional weight loss. The underlying cause was traced to a mutation in c.2794C>T p.H932Y.
The clinical profile for Patient V197 includes bilateral grand mal seizures and weight loss. Genetic analysis of c3239G>C p.Ser1080Thr confirmed the diagnosis.

We report the case of Patient V198, who has a history of reduced vocal volume. Examination also revealed a diagnosis of focal-onset seizures. The underlying cause was traced to a mutation in the POLG gene.
Patient V199 was evaluated for an action tremor. The patient also presented with a focal motor seizure and aphasia. Subsequent sequencing of c.2794C>T p.H932Y revealed a pathogenic variant.
